awd_titl_txt: RIA: Multidimensional Bayesian Signal Reconstruction        Motivated by X-ray Crystallography
awd_abstract_narration: At the heart of this proposal is the very difficult X-ray                       crystallography reconstruction problem - given the magnitude of the             Fourier transform of the electron density of a crystal, reconstruct             the electron density, and, hence, determine the locations of the                atoms of the molecule to be imaged.  The major theme is a new                   statistical approach based on Markov random fields which promises               to permit easier and more effective incorporation of prior                      information such as the possible locations of the atoms, and on the             valence structure of the bonds, and a more consistent use of                    statistical information.  Methods which will be developed during                the course of this investigation will be useful in other contexts               such as pattern recognition and nonconvex optimization.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
